title: Virtual Conversation: The Mundanity of This World and the Nether Realm
short_description:
How was everyday life portrayed by pre-modern Chinese painters? What are the compelling parallels and contrasts between lives of mortal beings and the experiences of ghosts inhabiting an underground realm?

Join Chicago Objects Study Initiative (COSI) fellows Xi Zhang and Meng Zhao to explore paintings illustrating the comical drudgery of commoners’ mundane lives and the commonplace experiences with which ghosts entertain and amuse themselves.
list_description: Explore everyday life as portrayed by pre-modern Chinese painters and discover the compelling parallels and contrasts between the lives of mortal beings and those of ghosts in an underground realm with COSI fellows Xi Zhang and Meng Zhao.
description:
How was everyday life portrayed by pre-modern Chinese painters? What are the compelling parallels and contrasts between lives of mortal beings and the experiences of ghosts inhabiting an underground realm?

Join Chicago Objects Study Initiative (COSI) fellows Xi Zhang and Meng Zhao to explore paintings illustrating the comical drudgery of commoners’ mundane lives and the commonplace experiences with which ghosts entertain and amuse themselves.

This virtual event will be hosted on Zoom. Find Zoom tutorials and resources here. If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.
